comments.body: Maybe it'd be worth to add FortiOS (FOS) as it's referenced later.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +27,31 @@short_description: Configure resource limits in Fortinet's FortiOS (FOS) and FortiGate.
description:
    - This module is able to configure a FortiGate or FortiOS device by allowing the
      user to set and modify system feature and resource_limits category.
      Examples include all parameters and values need to be adjusted to datasources before usage.

comments.body: is there any dependence to fortiosapi that should be on requriements?

When we submitted our first modules we had a discussion with RedHat maintainers about where to place or reference properly fortiosapi and we were told that it was good as it is (no need to put it on requirements or other places). Therefore I think it is not needed, but if you think otherwise I am happy to modify it.

Please take into account that fortiosapi will be deprecated soon, once HTTPAPI plugin is mandatory (we already support HTTPAPI but we still kept support for fortiosapi temporarily)

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +39,43 @@    - Run as a local_action in your playbook
requirements:
    - fortiosapi>=0.9.8
options:
    host:

comments.body: it might be worth adding an option to configure debugging, unless it's explicitly needed by the module.

That is an interesting proposal. Since it is an important change and we are close to the delivery date, can we agree on implementing it on the next round for 2.10?

Also take into account that we will deprecate fortiosapi as long as HTTPAPI is mandatory and the only possible way to connect.
no worries, let's make it for 2.10, but I think that debug option would be nice ;)

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +261,265 @@    ssl_verify = data['ssl_verify']

    fos.debug('on')
    if 'https' in data and not data['https']:
        fos.https('off')

comments.body: it might be worth adding a note about this legacy mode. Which version does it affect?
This refers to using fortiosapi instead of HTTPAPI. I can add a comment stating that if you agree.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +363,367 @@
    # legacy_mode refers to using fortiosapi instead of HTTPAPI.
    legacy_mode = 'host' in module.params and module.params['host'] is not None and \
                  'username' in module.params and module.params['username'] is not None and \
                  'password' in module.params and module.params['password'] is not None
